void * reserveSpace,

so it is read/write, and only in backwardFilter it is

const void * reserveSpace,

And yes, you always have to call cudnnRNNBackwardData even if your inputs don't require gradients, because of back propagation through time (or so I've been told).

body:
Ah, you are right, my mistake (should not have relied on memory). In backwardData it is 
```                                              
void * reserveSpace,
``` 
so it is read/write, and only in backwardFilter it is 
```
const void * reserveSpace,
```

And yes, you always have to call cudnnRNNBackwardData even if your inputs don't require gradients, because of back propagation through time (or so I've been told).
